title: Understanding Data Breaches and How to Respond

understanding.heading: What is a Data Breach?
paragraphs: A data breach occurs when sensitive, confidential, or protected data is accessed or disclosed without authorization.

bullets.label: Unauthorized Access
bullets.desc: When an individual gains access to data without permission.

bullets.label: Phishing
bullets.desc: Fraudulent attempts to obtain sensitive information.

bullets.label: Weak Passwords
bullets.desc: Easily guessable passwords leading to security risks.

bullets.label: Unpatched Software
bullets.desc: Failure to update software leaves systems vulnerable.

bullets.label: Use Strong Passwords
bullets.desc: Create complex passwords and update them regularly.

bullets.label: Enable Two-Factor Authentication
bullets.desc: Add an extra layer of security to your accounts.

impact.heading: Impact of a Data Breach
paragraphs: Data breaches can have severe financial, reputational, and legal consequences for organizations and individuals.

response.heading: Responding to a Data Breach
paragraphs: Organizations must act quickly to contain the breach, notify affected parties, and take steps to prevent future incidents.
